Posts.Content: May 2, 2010 05:51PM jessicawollin wrote: Have you been doing anything else to decrease your chances of getting BC? Or have you gone through genetic testing to see if you have a gene mutation? I am only 27, but because of my strong family history of BC and my positive result for the gene mutation, the doctors already have me alternating MRIs and Mammograms every 6 months. I also have dense areas where they need to focus on and do ultrasounds just to make sure. They have found "suspicious" areas (I hate when they use that word), but want to follow them for growth or blood supply before doing any biopsies. So I'll what happens in 6 months. So anyway, I know how it feels to wonder and worry about all that mumble jumble.
Posts.Title: Mom had BC at 37. Now I'm 37. Got MRI back today JDG MelissaDallas
